What was the first tool used by humans?
Stone tools, over 2 million years ago
What is Moore's Law?
Computing power doubles within every 2 years
Which country sends human into space first?
Soviet Russia
What is the Paris Agreement?
Global pact to limit warming to 1.5 degrees, to which USA declined to participate
What is 5G?
Fifth-gen wireless, with faster speed than the current 4G
What is hyperloop?
The prototype of future transport, using high-speed vacuum tube
What is Maglev?
Magnetic levitation train, like the one in Shanghai
What is telehealth?
To diagnose through the use of video/internet with a medical professional.
What are nanobots and their use?
Microscopic robots for medical/industrial use.
What is stealth technology?
A military technology aiming at reducing radar detection
What is cyberwarfare?
Digital attacks on infrastructure/military controls
What does EMP do?
Electro-Magnetic pulse which disables electronics (particularly in weaponries)
What is Dolby Atmos?
3D spatial audio technology
What is an NFT?
Non-Fungible Token, a digital ownership of something.
What is the most commonly used material for 3D printing?
plastic
What does a CNC machine do?
It is a very important part of all components that requires extremely high precision to make (Computer Numerical Control)
What is robotics's Three Laws?
Dont harm humans, obey, self-preserve
What the meaning of the term "the digital divide"?
The gap between those who use/have access to modern tech such as the internet and smart devices and those who don't
Can you trust AI to be unbiased?
No, they are created by people with bias, to various degrees.
What are the three main things that make self-driving cars work?
sensors / Machine Learning / real-time data
What is a "Turing Test"?
A test to determine if a machine can mimic human intelligence
What does a DDos attack do?
Overwhelming a server with fake traffic
What is Starlink?
Using low-orbit satellites to providing global broadband internet, requires high usage fees and large dish receiver
Radar is to land as what is to water?
Sonar
What is induction cooktop?
It uses electromagnetic field to cause campatible magnetic pan to heat up.
Is AI enviromental friendly?
No, it consumes massive amount of energy to function.
How does cloud gaming work?
Games are streamed from servers, which removes the requirement for hardware
What does "fatigue" mean in materials?
Mainly refering to the cracks appear in metals from excessive usage
What is big data?
Extremely large datasets (stealthy collected by large internet companies fro m users) that are analyzed for patterns
What are the restrictions with powerbank on flight, and why?
1) no large powerbank, higher risk of explosion / 2) no powerbanks in check in luggage, to avoid impact damage / 3) no charging during flight, chance of fire
